Consumer complaint narrative: The federal student loan COVID-19 forbearance program ended in XX/XX/XXXX. However, payments were not re-amortized on my federal student loans currently serviced by Nelnet until very recently. The new payment amount that is effective starting with the XX/XX/XXXX payment will nearly double my payment from {$180.00} per month to {$360.00} per month. I'm fortunate that my current financial position allows me to be able to handle the increased payment amount, but I am sure there are likely many borrowers who are not in the same position. The re-amortization should have occurred once the forbearance ended to reduce the impact to borrowers.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I submitted my annual Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) recertification to Aidvantage on time and in full, using the correct process. My income is approximately $ XXXX/year, which is below 150 % of the federal poverty guideline. Under the SAVE Plan or any valid IDR/IBR plan , this income level qualifies for a $ XXXX monthly payment. 

Instead, Aidvantage assigned me a $ XXXX/month paymentan amount that is not legally or mathematically possible based on my income. I contacted them and was placed in a two-month administrative forbearance. After that, they returned with the exact same incorrect payment amount. 

When I pressed for clarification, Aidvantage responded that my IDR application has not been processed yet, even though they had already issued a bill and claimed it was based on a recalculation. This is a clear contradiction. You can not bill a borrower for an IDR plan amount before processing the application. 

Aidvantage has not requested any additional documentation from me. There has been no communication asking for clarification or income verification beyond my original submission. 

I am requesting : A correction of my repayment amount in accordance with my documented income ; A written explanation of how the erroneous amount was calculated ; A guarantee that no delinquency or negative credit reporting occurs while this dispute is unresolved ; An investigation into why borrowers are being billed despite applications not being processed.

I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information on my credit report. This dispute is submitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 16811, which requires credit reporting agencies to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items.

Recent findings by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) have brought to light significant concerns regarding XXXX  and XXXX XXXX failure to conduct proper investigations. Specifically, in a lawsuit filed against XXXX  and XXXX, the CFPB alleges that the company engaged in sham investigations, violating consumer protection laws by failing to meet its obligations under the FCRA.

As per 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), XXXX  and XXXX  is required to conduct a thorough and reasonable reinvestigation of disputed items within 30 days. Furthermore, under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), any information found to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable must be promptly deleted or corrected. Failure to adhere to these requirements constitutes a violation of federal law.

Conduct a thorough reinvestigation of the following disputed accounts or items : EDFinancial Services through 15 accounts totaling {$35000.00}.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a formal legal demand for immediate investigation and permanent deletion of all student loan accounts reported under the tradeline " DEPT OF XXXX, '' which is NELNET, XXXX my credit report. These accounts include all loanssubsidized, unsubsidized, and Parent PLUSand their continued presence on my report constitutes an egregious violation of federal privacy statutes and consumer protection law. 

It has come to light through extensive reporting and insider disclosures that entities affiliated with or under the operational influence of XXXX XXXX, specifically DOGE-related ventures, gained illegal and unrestricted access to sensitive borrower data stored within Department of Education systems. This information includes the entirety of my student loan file, which is protected under longstanding federal privacy law and explicit contractual obligations governing the use, access, and safeguarding of this data. 

The unauthorized access to my personal and financial records constitutes a direct violation of the Privacy Act of 1974, the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ( FERPA ), the Higher Education Act, and the Federal Trade Commission Act, among others. In addition, the Department of Education, by failing to prevent such a breach, has defaulted on its contractual duties, materially violating the terms of agreement I entered into as a borrower. As a matter of contract law, this breach voids the contract in its entirety, rendering all outstanding balances unenforceable. The contract is no longer valid and therefore all associated reporting must cease immediately. 

Furthermore, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), consumer reporting agencies are required to report only information that is complete and verifiable. The data being reported by your bureau in relation to the " DEPT OF EDUCATION/NELN '' tradeline is now under legal dispute due to illegality of origin and breach of contract. Continued furnishing or reinsertion of this information without legal justification or lawful verification constitutes willful noncompliance with federal law, making your agency liable under 15 U.S. Code 1681n and 1681o for civil damages. 

Nelnet, the loan servicer responsible for these accounts, is equally liable for their role in the breach. As the originating furnisher of this erroneous and contractually voided data, Nelnet must immediately cease all furnishing of student loan information related to my name and render all associated accounts as deleted and paid in full, or otherwise indicate closure in good standing with XXXX balance due. It is unlawful and unconscionable to continue enforcing repayment obligations upon a client whose contractual terms have been breached by the government and its appointed agents. As such, I owe no further amount under any condition, and the record of these accounts must reflect that accordingly. 

Any delay or attempt to obstruct this dispute under the guise of identity verification is hereby nullified. My government-issued identification, including the front and back of my drivers license, my social security verification, and XXXX XXXX statement showing my current address, are all included in the PDF file named XXXX XXXX XXXX' which is already uploaded to the CFPB complaint system. This document satisfies all verification standards imposed by any bureau or furnisher. Therefore, I demand that you acknowledge receipt of this dispute and cease all reporting activity related to the tradeline in question until the matter is resolved. I will pursue legal recourse in small claims court and escalate to federal jurisdiction should you ignore or inadequately address this matter. My legal team is fully prepared to pursue compensatory and punitive damages for emotional, financial, and reputational harm. 

You have been formally notified.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint concerning serious violations related to the management and security of my student loan data. These violations have caused harm to my financial well-being, breached my federally protected privacy rights, and I am requesting that appropriate action be taken to investigate and rectify the matter, including full discharge of my student loan debt and removal of related accounts from my credit reports. 

1. Violation of FERPA ( Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ) : As a borrower of federally guaranteed student loans, I am entitled to protections under FERPA, which mandates the confidentiality and proper use of my education records. My student loan data, which includes personally identifiable information ( PII ), was handled and shared in ways that violated these protections, especially in light of recent disclosures involving third-party servicers and unauthorized data access. These disclosures were made without my knowledge or explicit consent.

2. Violation of the Higher Education Act of XXXX : The Higher Education Act includes provisions to ensure that student loans are administered fairly and that students rights are protected. The failure to secure my sensitive financial and academic information and the inability to provide transparency and accountability from loan servicers constitutes a violation of the intent and letter of this law. 

3. Violation of the Privacy Act of XXXX : This federal law requires that federal agencies and contractors who collect, maintain, and disseminate personal information do so with explicit safeguards and procedures. My XXXX XXXX information, held and shared by the Department of Education and its contracted servicers, has been subject to data breaches and mishandling, constituting gross violations of this Act. I was not given timely notice or meaningful redress following these breaches.

4. Data Breaches and Mismanagement of Private Information : Multiple reports in recent years, including public disclosures by the Department of Education and its servicing partners, have confirmed breaches and unauthorized access of borrower data, affecting millions of student loan borrowers whose private informationincluding Social Security number, loan balances, repayment history, and other sensitive datahas been compromised.

These breaches, combined with the federal violations listed above, have not only endangered my financial privacy but have also negatively impacted my credit report and mental and emotional well-being. I did not consent to my data being exposed, nor was I provided any reasonable opportunity to prevent or mitigate this damage.

Requested Action : In light of these legal violations and the lack of accountability by the Department of Education and its third-party loan servicers, I formally request the following : 1. A full and permanent discharge of all my federal student loan obligations under the authority of borrower defense and/or violation of federal privacy laws.

2. Immediate removal of all student loan accounts from my credit report, as they are tied to improperly handled and compromised information.

3. A full investigation into how my personal information was shared, stored, and breached.

4. A clear explanation of what steps, if any, have been taken by federal authorities and servicers to address these violations and protect borrowers like me.

I respectfully request a prompt review of this complaint and look forward to your response and action. Please contact me via email or phone to confirm receipt and discuss next steps.

Thank you for your time and attention to this serious matter.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to express my growing frustration and serious concern regarding EdFinancials continued mishandling of my student loan accountdespite my repeated attempts to resolve the matter with proper documentation and through the appropriate channels.

Last year, I submitted a formal complaint along with verified documentation confirming my continuous enrollment in school, which legally qualifies me for an in-school deferment under federal regulations. In direct contradiction to this, EdFinancial added a {$90.00} charge to my accountan action that is not only unjustified but also unlawful. 

XXXX XXXX University submitted official verification of my enrollment directly to EdFinancial. I am once again attaching that documentation. In addition, I received a federal student loan disbursement as recently as XX/XX/year> and have completed my exit counselingclear indicators that I am actively enrolled and compliant with federal guidelines. 

Despite this, EdFinancial continues to ignore these legally binding facts. Let me be clear : students enrolled at least half-time are entitled to deferment under the law. EdFinancials blatant disregard of this is unacceptable and appears to be a calculated attempt to force borrowers into repayment status in violation of federal policy. This is not just negligenceit mirrors the tactics of a predatory financial institution.

I am also deeply disturbed to discover that EdFinancial has changed the login credentials for my account without my consent. This has effectively locked me out of my account, and your password reset process requires an account numberwhich, ironically, can not be retrieved without logging into the account itself. This creates a closed loop that appears deliberately designed to obstruct borrowers from managing their accounts and to increase the likelihood of default. 

What began as a {$90.00} error has now ballooned into a balance of {$1900.00}, despite the fact that I am still actively enrolled in college. This is not only outrageous, it borders on abuse.

Furthermore, it is worth noting that EdFinancial representatives previously expressed dissatisfaction when I declined to enter repayment while pursuing my graduate degree. Let me be clear : EdFinancial has no authority to dictate when I must repay my loans when I am eligible for deferment. The coercive tactics being employed here are unacceptable.

I am demanding the immediate removal of all erroneous charges and a full correction of my account to reflect my lawful deferment status. If this matter is not resolved without delay, I will be filing a formal complaint with the U.S. Department of Education, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, and will also seek legal counsel to explore further action.

This continued mismanagement is not only unethical, it is illegal. I expect a response within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is regarding my frustration and concern regarding the recent transfer of my federal student loan to XXXX and the lack of appropriate communication surrounding this change. 

To be clear, I received XXXX email from the Department of Education notifying me of the transfer. After that, I only became aware of emails from " XXXX ''. Given the frequency of spam and phishing attempts, this is not a reliable or appropriate method of communicating such a significant change. I received XXXX phone calls/voicemails, XXXX text messages, and XXXX mailed notices to my home address regarding the transfer of my student loan servicer. 

The first truly official notice I received came in the form of a credit report update, showing my account as delinquent and causing my credit score to drop by over XXXX points. As someone with a pristine payment history, this is completely unacceptable and incredibly damaging. 

It should go without saying that clear and proactive communication, especially regarding federal loan servicing, is a basic expectation. I am requesting immediate action to resolve this error and to correct the negative impact on my credit. Please confirm that this issue is being investigated and provide a timeline for resolution.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Complaint Against TransUnion for Failure to Investigate and Accurately Report XXXX Account Violations of the FCRA and Metro 2 Guidelines Dear CFPB Complaint Review XXXX, I am filing this complaint against TransUnion, LLC for their failure to conduct a meaningful and legally compliant investigation into inaccurate credit reporting regarding my XXXX student loan account. Despite repeated contact and documentation, TransUnion has failed to uphold its obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and industry-standard Metro 2 compliance procedures. 

Background : Over the course of several months, I have submitted multiple disputes and inquiries to TransUnion concerning the accuracy and reporting status of my XXXX account. Despite receiving two vague, non-committal emails from TransUnion stating they are looking into it, there has been no evidence of a proper reinvestigation or corrective action, in direct violation of federal law. 
In addition to contacting TransUnion directly, I have filed formal written complaints and submitted evidence to : The United States Senate and Congressional Representatives The Attorney Generals Office The Consumer Protection Division The U.S. Department of Education, including the Office of General Counsel Federal XXXX Aid ( FSA ) Complaint Center XXXX and TransUnion ( via email and certified mail ) Furthermore, I submitted an application for the Loan Discharge Request ( LDR ) in XX/XX/year>, which has remained in " review '' status without any decision, updates, or correspondence from XXXX. Despite this pending application, my student loans were allowed to default, severely damaging my credit and causing financial and emotional distress. I received no contact by phone, email, or postal mail notifying me of the default status. 
To date, I have submitted a total of three LDR applications and one formal Discharge application seeking relief. None of these have been responded to or processed properly. Meanwhile, TransUnion continues to report inaccurate and incomplete information about this account without verifying its accuracy or properly documenting the ongoing disputes and discharge requests. 

Legal Violations : XXXX. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Reinvestigation FCRA 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) requires CRAs to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation when a consumer disputes information. TransUnion has failed to comply by providing no detailed response or outcome while continuing to report disputed data. 
2. Failure to Maintain Procedural Accuracy FCRA 607 ( b ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) TransUnion is required to maintain procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer data. Reporting a defaulted XXXX account despite a pending discharge/LDR application demonstrates procedural failure and negligence. 
3. Metro 2 Compliance Violations Under Metro 2 reporting standards, furnishers and CRAs must correctly reflect dispute codes, deferment/forbearance status, and discharge claims. TransUnion has failed to apply the appropriate codes or suppress reporting while the dispute is ongoing. 
4. Negligent and Willful Noncompliance FCRA 616 & 617 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n, 1681o ) TransUnion has demonstrated both negligence and willful disregard for the law by continuing to report inaccurate information and failing to correct or investigate the errors, despite ample notice Requested Resolution : Immediate reinvestigation of the XXXX account, with full validation of data and detailed documentation of the source. 

Immediate correction or removal of any XXXX tradeline inaccurately reported in violation of the FCRA and Metro 2 guidelines. 

Cease reporting any default status or negative information while Loan Discharge and LDR applications remain pending. 

An official written response from TransUnion outlining their investigation and confirming full compliance with legal obligations. 

Referral or enforcement action by the CFPB for TransUnions consistent failure to follow the FCRA and industry standards. 

TransUnion 's ongoing disregard for procedural accuracy and consumer rights not only violates federal law but causes serious, real-world harm. I am requesting the CFPB hold them fully accountable for their lack of action and require proper investigation and correction. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the enforceability of my federal student loan agreement on the basis of a **material alteration to the original contract**. 
According to the terms outlined in my promissory note, my loan was issued and administered by the **U.S. Department of Education** . As such, I dispute the continued enforceability of this obligation under its current structure.

I was not notified by MOHELA that this payment was reversed, and because I was enrolled in auto pay, I reasonably believed that my payments were continuing to process normally. I did not receive any alerts, emails, or other forms of communication informing me of a failed or missed payment. 

MOHELA did not attempt to retry the auto payment after it was reversed, and they did not notify me of any issue with my account or payment status. As a result, I continued to assume my payments were being made. On XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my account and saw that multiple months of payments had not gone through. As soon as I realized this, I immediately made a large payment to cover the entire missed balance. 

Despite my good faith effort and the lack of notification or retry attempts on their part, MOHELA reported the missed payments to the credit bureaus, negatively impacting my credit report. I believe this is unfair and misleading, especially given that I was enrolled in auto pay, received no notice of a problem, and was not given a chance to remedy the situation until I discovered it myself months later.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against Aidvantage ( previously Navient ) for failing to execute a lawful loan discharge under the Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) Adjustment provision, in clear violation of : 20 U.S.C. 1087e ( d ) requiring loan discharge after 240 qualifying payments, and 34 CFR 685.206 obligating servicers to provide accurate information and not obstruct borrower rights.

I have made 609 cumulative qualifying payments across 8 federal student loans dating back to XXXX, as detailed below. These include periods of repayment, forbearance, and defermentmuch of which qualifies under the IDR Account Adjustment rules issued by the Department of Education. 

Payment Breakdown ( based on my account records ) : XXXX Stafford Subsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Stafford Unsubsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Stafford Subsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Stafford Unsubsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Direct Loan Subsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Direct Loan Unsubsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Direct Loan Subsidized : XXXX payments XXXX Direct Loan Unsubsidized : XXXX payments Total : XXXX payments In XXXX, I contacted XXXX/Aidvantage  and explicitly requested my IDR adjustment months count. The representative verbally confirmed that my total payments exceed the XXXX requirement under IDR forgiveness, and that my loans were eligible for full discharge by XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, they also informed me that my discharge has been delayed due to technical limitations and staffing issues, not because of ineligibility. As of today, I am still waiting for this discharge to be honored, despite statutory eligibility.

The Higher Education Act mandates loan forgiveness after 240 payments under IDR plans ( 20 U.S.C. 1087e ( d ) ).

Federal regulation ( 34 CFR 685.206 ) requires servicers to uphold borrower rights and not impede lawful discharge. 

I am now suffering financially and psychologically from an unjust delay that contradicts both the spirit and the letter of the law. Being currently unemployed, and interest continually accruing, it is unlikely that I can ever catch up on paying these loans.

When I complained no steps were taken to correct this issue, plus DOGE is trying to access personal sensitive data, a breach this comes from off the website of my account every time I access it, You are accessing a U.S. Federal Government computer system intended to be solely accessed by individual users expressly authorized to access the system by the U.S. Department of Education. Usage may be monitored, recorded, and/or subject to audit. For security purposes and in order to ensure that the system remains available to all expressly authorized users, the U.S. Department of Education monitors the system to identify unauthorized users. Anyone using this system expressly consents to such monitoring and recording. Unauthorized use of this information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties. Except as expressly authorized by the U.S. Department of Education, unauthorized attempts to access, obtain, upload, modify, change, and/or delete information on this system are strictly prohibited and are subject to criminal prosecution under 18 U.S.C 1030, and other applicable statutes, which may result in fines and imprisonment. For purposes of this system, unauthorized access includes, but is not limited to : any access by an employee or agent of a commercial entity, or other third party, who is not the individual user, for purposes of commercial advantage or private financial gain ( regardless of whether the commercial entity or third party is providing a service to an authorized user of the system ) ; and any access in furtherance of any criminal or tortious act in violation of the Constitution or laws of the United States or any State.

If system monitoring reveals information indicating possible criminal activity, such evidence may be provided to law enforcement personnel.

DOGE is not affiliated with the government.

I am formally disputing the student loan accounts reported under my name due to material changes in federal student loan administration following the executive order issued by XXXX XXXX to abolish the U.S. Department of Education. This unprecedented action has created substantial uncertainty regarding the legitimacy, ownership, and enforceability of student loan debts that were previously under the purview of the Department of Education.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX/2025 ________________________________________ To Whom It May Concern : Subject : Dispute and Complaint Regarding Student Loan Transfer to SBA I am writing to formally dispute the transfer and servicing of my student loan account, which I originally entered into under a promissory note with the U.S. Department of Education ( DoE ). I did not agree to, nor was I notified of, any legally valid transfer of this debt to the U.S. Small Business Administration ( SBA ), and I believe this situation involves misrepresentation, improper reassignment, and potential violations of my borrower rights. 
Background : My original student loan was executed through a promissory note with the Department of Education, not with the Small Business Administration. 
I have recently discovered that my loan is now being managed or claimed by the SBA, without my consent or a new promissory agreement. 
At no point did I sign a contract or legally binding document with the SBA regarding this debt. 
Additionally, I reference an Executive Order issued under President Donald J. Trump, which effectively dismantled or significantly altered the authority or structure of the Department of Education. If the DoE was disbanded or restructured in a way that invalidates prior agreements or agency authority, that raises legal and constitutional concerns about this loans enforceability under a new agency. 
Dispute and Legal Concerns : I dispute the validity of any attempt to collect on this loan under the SBA. 
I believe the transfer of my student loan without consent violates basic contract law and federal regulations governing student loans. 
This action may also violate the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and other applicable consumer protection statutes. 
Requested Actions : 1. I request an immediate investigation into the legality of the loan transfer or reassignment.

2. I request written documentation showing how the loan was legally transferred, including a signed agreement if one exists.

3. I request that all collection efforts by the SBA cease until this dispute is resolved.

4. If this transfer is found to be improper or unlawful, I request the loan be discharged or returned to its original status with the appropriate federal student loan servicing authority.

I appreciate your urgent attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Public record information inaccurate
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX AZ XXXXXXXX SSN : XXXX DOB : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX To : Aidvantage  / Maximus : XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX TX XXXXXXXX RE : Dispute of Unverified Student Loan Accounts Immediate Deletion Requested To Whom It May Concern, This letter is a formal dispute submitted in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., concerning the reporting of student loan accounts associated with Aidvantage, XXXX on my XXXX credit file. 

1. ISSUE : Lack of Verification of a Signed Master Promissory Note ( MPN ) Relevant Law : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), a credit reporting agency must conduct a reasonable reinvestigation if a consumer disputes the completeness or accuracy of any item in their file. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), the CRA must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information it includes. 
Demand : I am demanding immediate deletion of the referenced student loan account ( s ) from my XXXX  credit file unless the data furnisher can provide the original, wet-ink signed Master Promissory Note ( MPN ) establishing a valid, enforceable obligation in my name. Electronic reproduction or summary data is not sufficient under federal evidentiary standards, particularly when the debt is disputed. The burden of proof lies with the furnisher. If the original contract does not exist, the tradeline must be removed. 

2. ISSUE : Failure to Verify Current Status Forbearance or Administrative Hold Relevant Law : Per 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ), the information furnisher is obligated to investigate disputed information and correct or delete any data found to be inaccurate or unverifiable. If a loan is in administrative forbearance, deferment, or a non-repayment status due to federal policy or executive order, such status must be clearly and accurately reflected in the reporting. Failure to do so constitutes willful misreporting and inaccurate furnishing of information. 
Demand : Please verify whether this account is presently subject to administrative forbearance or any federal hold. If it is, it can not legally be reported as delinquent or in default. If this can not be fully verified and proven by the data furnisher, the account must be removed immediately for failure to meet accuracy and verification standards outlined by the FCRA. 

3. ISSUE : XXXX XXXX and XXXX  Compliance Failure Relevant Law : The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( XXXX  ) XXXX XXXX Format Guidelines, which XXXX has adopted for credit furnishing, require that all tradelines be accurate, complete, and up-to-date. Reporting disputed, unverifiable, or administratively frozen debts violates these guidelines. 
Demand : You are required to remove any entry that does not conform with XXXX XXXX  and XXXX  standards. Student loans that are not contractually verified or are impacted by legislative changes ( such as federal repayment pauses or executive actions ) must not be reported as adverse. If you can not validate this account according to those standards, it must be removed. 

Failure to Comply Will Result in Further Action This is a legal dispute under the FCRA. Should you fail to respond within 30 days with sufficient documentation, I will escalate the matter with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and consider further legal action under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o for willful or negligent noncompliance. 

Summary of Accounts to be Investigated and Deleted : Aidvantage / Account Number Ending in XXXX Aidvantage / Account Number Ending in XXXX  Enclosures : Copy of Photo ID Proof of Address ( Utility Bill or Bank Statement ) Copy of Credit Report Highlighting the Student Loan Accounts Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX .

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against the student loan servicing companies Aidvantage and XXXX regarding a suspected and highly plausible violation of my personal and educational data privacy rights. I believe my sensitive informationsubmitted through the federal student aid system and managed by these servicersmay have been accessed, disclosed, or mishandled without my consent, in violation of multiple federal laws. 

Specifically, I suspect violations of : FERPA ( Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act ), which protects the confidentiality of my education records ; The Privacy Act of 1974, which restricts federal agencies from disclosing personal information without authorization ; The Higher Education Act, which limits the use of FAFSA data solely to administering aid. 

These suspicions are based on widespread reports of unauthorized access to federal student aid data ( e.g., the Department of Educations DOGE program and past servicer data breaches involving millions of borrowers ). While I have not been officially notified, the scale and nature of these privacy lapses make it entirely plausible that my information was compromised. I never gave written consent for my personal data to be shared with third parties for any purpose beyond the direct servicing of my loan.

As a result, I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and support my demand for the full discharge of my federal student loans, as my privacy rights have been severely violated.

Issue: Improper use of your report
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Dispute of Multiple Inaccurate Accounts Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute multiple inaccurate accounts appearing on my credit report, specifically those associated with DEPTEDNELNET XXXX XXXX XXXX. These inaccuracies are serious and must be corrected or deleted in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

The specific accounts and issues are as follows : All DEPTEDNELNET XXXX XXXX XXXX accounts listed report an impossible " Date Closed '' of XX/XX/XXXX. 
Each account is marked " Account Closed '' but simultaneously reports the " Account Status '' as " Open, '' which is contradictory and misleading. 
Several accounts are missing, incomplete, or inconsistent regarding the credit limit information. 
The opened dates range from XXXX to XXXX, making the listed XXXX closure date a clear inaccuracy. 
These inaccuracies violate my rights under : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Mandating that consumer reporting agencies maintain maximum possible accuracy of reported information. 
15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Requiring a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and deletion of unverifiable or inaccurate data. 
Requested Action : I formally demand that you : Immediately investigate and verify all information regarding these DEPTEDNELNET XXXX XXXX XXXX accounts. 
Correct all inaccurate information ( specifically closure dates, account statuses, and missing/incomplete account details ). 
Remove any unverifiable or inaccurate accounts that can not be corrected within the statutory period. 
Provide written results of your investigation and an updated copy of my credit report, free of charge. 

If these errors are not corrected or removed within the 30-day period allowed under the FCRA, I will pursue additional remedies available to me, including but not limited to submitting complaints to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), State Attorney General, and other applicable authorities.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect full compliance and timely resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint : Drastically increased my monthly payment, not approving IDR applications, and screwing up a refund for four months. 

As of XX/XX/XXXX my student loan balance was {$36000.00}, and I was making {$200.00} monthly payments for years. I went back to school in XX/XX/XXXX and went on In-School Deferment.

In-School Deferment sends XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX XXXX = {$50000.00}. 

Only a few days before XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage says I have {$750.00} due on that day as my first payment. Begrudgingly I pay via XXXX as I don't want my count to go delinquent. I call Aidvantage and ask why this amount is so large compared to what I am historically used to paying. They have no answer and can't lower it. I apply for SAVE plan at this time. They confirmed I provided all documents and just need to wait for approval. They do NOT put me on another forbearance due to my application. 

XX/XX/XXXX I get an email notification saying my account is delinquent, and that I owe {$240.00} right now, despite paying {$750.00} via XXXX, and balance owed was XXXX just XXXX days prior. I manually pay {$240.00}, and then I call in an ask why this happened. They have no answer and never give me an answer. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on XXXX application status. 

XX/XX/XXXX I pay {$750.00} again via XXXX, no news on SAVE application status. I call in and ask the status of my SAVE application. They can not find my application until I give them specific dates, and miraculously they find my application. They then tell me that they didn't receive any of my require income documentation despite my sending in months prior and being told it all looks good. Because of this, my original application was never considered. I am angry, I provide them with Income docs, and they restart my application. They put me on a two month application forbearance at this time. 

XX/XX/XXXX my forbearance ends. Next day I see I owe now {$980.00} per month starting in THREE DAYS!!! Three days advanced notice of another wild price jump. I immediately cancel XXXX as I do not trust it due to earlier problems. I manually pay {$980.00} and it is applied to my account on the XX/XX/XXXX due date. However, also on XX/XX/XXXX, Aidvantage takes {$760.00} from my bank account via XXXX, despite cancelling XXXX a week prior!!! So now they have a total of {$1700.00} payment from me for month of XX/XX/XXXX. 

I call Aidvantage and complain. It takes XXXX minutes into the call before they even admit to the mistake. I tell them to use that extra payment and apply it to my future account so that I do not owe for next month. They say this is acceptable. 

XX/XX/XXXX I notice the {$760.00} completely disappears from my " Recent Payments '' section in Aidvantage XXXX. Confuse, I call in and they tell me a refund has been issued for {$760.00}. I complain that I didn't want a refund, and they ignored me, but then I say " whatever '', I will wait for this refund. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account updates saying my next payment is due on XX/XX/XXXX, and that it is for {$400.00}. I manually pay this amount. Completely frustrated, I call into Aidvantage and ask again for the status of my refund, AND I ask for the status of my SAVE Plan application. They say applications aren't processing right now. As for my refund, they say the original ticket was put in incorrectly and the refund was never issued. They escalate the ticket at this time and I am told the {$760.00} refund process is starting over. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page updates in Aidvantage saying that my next payment is {$960.00}, due on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I am angry at this point and say I don't care about the SAVE plan anymore, and ask if there is another IDR plan they are accepting applications for at this time? I'm told I can try the ICR plan which would bring my monthly payment down to {$600.00} a month. I tell them to cancel my SAVE Plan application, and start a new application for ICR Plan. I provide all of my documents. They put me on a two month NON-interest accruing forbearance while this application is being reviewed. 

XX/XX/XXXX, I get notification that my account has update, but instead of my account page saying that I owe {$0.00} for XX/XX/XXXX, I am instead now delinquent and that I owe {$6.00} due NOW. I manually pay this amount. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX my account page says that I owe {$0.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and XXXX XXXX is XXXX. I do have a new XXXX though saying my forbearance is ending XX/XX/XXXX. No refund received yet for {$760.00}. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( today ) I call Aidvantage. I tell them I still have not received my {$760.00} refund which was first initiated XX/XX/XXXX. They research my tickets and now tell me the original refund ticket was put in for {$400.00}, which is wrong. I told them this is not true, otherwise why did {$760.00} disappear from my recent payments. It was clearly approved for refund. The Aidvantage representative can not tell me why the refund hasn't been completed yet, and that they are putting in another escalation for this today, with a processing estimate of another XXXX to XXXX weeks. 

I also ask the representative for the status of my new XXXX plan application. She tells me that all ICR applications are not being reviewed right now. I say " Wait, I was TOLD on XX/XX/XXXX that ICR plans ARE being reviewed, and this is the entire reason I cancelled my SAVE plan applcation in the first place. Now I'm being told that this is not true, and that ALL Income-driven repayment plans are on pause, not just SAVE. I was either lied to or given false information, and this caused me to cancel my SAVE application that had been in processing for six months.

I am ALSO now told that the two-month non-interest accruing forbearance I was put on these past two month is ACTUALLY an interest accruing forbearance. Another lie told to me on XX/XX/XXXX. 

The current representative tells me that my next payment is due XX/XX/XXXX, but she can not tell me how much it will be. She said the system will automatically put me in forbearance if my newer XXXX plan application hasn't been approved yet, but I know this is a lie. It has never done this before. I'm told if it doesn't do it automatically, that I should call them a week before the XXXX payment is due. 

Based on history pattern, I fully expect my XX/XX/XXXX payment to now be even HIGHER, and it won't appear on my account until a couple days before it is due. This company is paying with lives, I CAN NOT afford a {$1000.00} payment every month and I'm been attempting to get it lowered for XXXX months now. 

If I have to pick between paying mortgage/feeding my child, and paying this XXXX student loan, this student loan is going into default. I don't even XXXX care anymore about my credit. I own everything I need already. Aidvantage does not want to work with me and thinks bullying me into submission via incompetence will just force me to pay higher payments.

Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services
Sub-issue: Problem with product or service terms changing
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around XX/XX/XXXX our bank notified us that our credit score had significantly changed. When we investigated this we found that it related to 3 student loans that had been paused due to Covid in XXXX Apparently the loans were restarted in XXXX of XXXX but we never were notified and only found out that the loans were delinquent thru our bank. 

A major factor, we believe, for the communication problem was that the manager of our loan switched from XXXX to NelNet & Nelnet is now servicing the loan. Because it was a different company we did receive phone messages and emails that NelNet says they sent. We have spoken twice to NelNet ( on or about and they have been unhelpful. 

We changed our email in XXXX and were not using the previous email that XXXX had. Additionally, if NelNet called my phone number I likely did not answer because I had no idea who it was and according to NelNet they were using a dialer and never left messages. 

It seems NelNet did the bare minimum to attempt to contact me to let me know they were the new servicing agency ( never called and left a message, never sent a piece of mail ) and that the loan process had started back up from Covid. Now they have damaged my credit. NelNet said there was nothing they could do to change the credit report and seemed to not care much about ruining someone's credit. Additionally, they were pretty rude in how they handled it. 

I understand, as they said, that it was my responsibility to let them know my email had changed, however it had been over 3 years since the last payment was due and it seems only reasonable to understand things change and more could have been done to assist in communication. 

As soon as I knew the loans were considered in default I paid the amount due. Additionally, I had never made a late payment in all the time I had the loans. I strongly believe that with the unusual circumstances surrounding Covid and the stopping and starting of the loans over a significant period of time, that now that I understand they have begun again, I should be granted some grace. I would sincerely appreciate it if the report to the credit agency could be removed as I have not had a late payment or problem with my credit for over 20 years. I also believe NelNet did the bare minimum to contact me to restart the loans and this is unfair and while they can try and justify it- it quite simply is wrong.

The attached document titled " XXXX '' is a summary of where my student loans were at in XXXX of XXXX. To my knowledge, nothing changed with loans from XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. At that time I owed approximately $ XXXX on my student loans serviced by Mohela.

Issue: Struggling to repay your loan
Sub-issue: Problem with your payment plan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was enrolled in automatic payments for my federal student loan prior to the COVID-19 forbearance period. During the pause, auto-debit was suspended. When payments resumed, I was not notified by my servicer that auto-pay would not restart automatically. As a result, I unintentionally missed three payments and was marked 90 days delinquent on my credit report. 

I brought the account current as soon as I discovered the error. Ive contacted the loan servicer, but they have refused to remove the late payment. I believe this negative mark is the result of a failure in communication and servicer procedures, not intentional nonpayment on my part. I am requesting the CFPB 's assistance in reviewing this matter and encouraging the servicer to make a one-time goodwill adjustment.

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, On XX/XX/year>, I experienced a significant and devastating drop in my credit scores : from approximately XXXX to XXXX on Experian, and from XXXX to XXXX on TransUnion. As a XXXX individual who has spent my entire adult life building and maintaining strong credit, this sudden decline has been not only financially damaging but also deeply disheartening. 

Prior to these recent Department of Education loan reports, my credit history was overwhelmingly positive, marked by over 99 % of on-time payments with only a few isolated XXXX  days past due occurrences, each of which were accidental and never reflective of an unwillingness to meet my obligations. I have consistently chosen to carry loans and pay extended interest to build and preserve my credit. This recent event has left me feeling utterly defeated, with the prospect of spending the next XXXX years working to rebuild my score seeming nearly insurmountable. 

In the past week, Ive read hundreds, if not thousands of testimonies from others who are enduring the exact same hardship. It is clear that this issue is not the result of individual negligence, but rather the consequence of a systemic breakdown impacting people nationwide. 

Before this change, I had approximately {$96000.00} in available credit card lines, of which only about 2 % was utilized. Now, with my credit scores severely affected, my available credit has been slashed to nearly nothing. As a result, I am currently unable to secure financing for a vehicle, a home, or any other need that depends on a functional credit score. 

The student loans in question were placed in forbearance while I pursued XXXX XXXX ( becoming a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and during the federal Covid-related pause. During this time, the loans were transferred to Nelnet and fragmented into XXXX separate accounts. Despite my efforts, including submitting paperwork on multiple occasions during the forbearance period and calling and talking to representatives, I was unable to complete the consolidation process or establish a manageable repayment plan. Importantly, these loans remained in forbearance throughout this time. 

Following the credit report changes on XX/XX/XXXX, I was finally able to speak with a representative at Nelnet, who graciously assisted in placing the loans back into forbearance ( after which they had been removed to forbearance without me understanding what was going on ) to allow time for consolidation and payment setup. I want to emphasize that I have never had the intention to avoid repaying any debt I owe or any debt I've ever owed. My long-standing credit record serves as a testament to that commitment. 

To characterize this situation as frustrating would be a gross understatement. The complexity and opacity of the current loan servicing and credit reporting system are overwhelming even to the most diligent and responsible individuals. There is a clear and urgent need for reform. I am incredibly grateful for the opportunity to have received student loans, as they allowed me to pursue an education that would not have been possible otherwise. I did not have familial financial support, and without a degree, I would never have had access to a job that could support repayment or my family entirely. 

However, many of us who have tried to do everything right now find ourselves in crisis. The system, as it stands, is failing the very people it was meant to empower, hardworking individuals striving to better themselves and contribute meaningfully to our country. We need help. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Additional information for the incorrect & inconsistency in the reporting process that was misleading to all borrowers ( attached document ).

Issue: Incorrect information on your report
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Formal Complaint Against Aidvantage  Unfair Reporting of Delinquency and Credit Damage To whom it may concern, I am filing this complaint in regard to a serious issue involving Aidvantages  handling of my federal student loans, specifically their decision to report my account as XXXX days delinquentresulting in a devastating drop of over XXXX points to my credit score. I believe this was an unfair and avoidable outcome, driven not by legal necessity but by rigid internal policy and an unwillingness to exercise discretion or provide reasonable assistance. 

Due to Aidvantages own system restrictions, the XXXX application portal was inaccessible throughout much of XXXX and XX/XX/year>. I was XXXX XXXX from my XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>, and immediately took steps to stabilize my financial situation. On XX/XX/year>, the very first day the system allowed it, I submitted my Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) application through XXXX. On XX/XX/year>, I received an official email from Aidvantage  confirming my account had been placed into forbearance. On XX/XX/year>, I received another message confirming that my account was in good standing. 

Despite all of this, Aidvantage  still reported multiple accounts as XXXX days delinquent as of XX/XX/XXXX, just one day before I was able to act. The result : severe and immediate damage to my credit profile, despite my proactive effort to resolve the matter as quickly as possible. 

This punishment is not based on financial misconduct or unwillingness to payit is a technicality. I have made clear to Aidvantage  that I am fully willing to set up payment arrangements or resolve any past-due balance, if one exists. Instead, I was told that they can not remove the delinquency because of the way their system locks in reporting at the end of the monthnot because they are legally prohibited from doing so, but because their policy will not allow it. I have even spoken with representatives at credit bureaus who confirmed that loan servicers do have discretion to retract negative reporting under certain circumstances. 

I am now facing serious, life-altering consequences : I have sold my car in preparation for a XX/XX/XXXX relocation to XXXX, XXXX  to start a XXXX  XXXX. 

With my credit score drastically lowered, I am unable to secure a new auto loan or be approved for an apartment. 

Without transportation or housing, I may be unable to begin employment, jeopardizing both my income and long-term financial stability. 

All I am asking for is fairness. My loans are currently in forbearance and reflect good standing. I acted in good faith the moment I was able. The delinquency status and its devastating impact on my credit are not representative of my intent, character, or current account status. 

I respectfully request that Aidvantage  retract the XXXX delinquency reporting, as it does not align with the broader context of this situation, nor with the flexibility I believe they are capable of exercising. 

Thank you for your time and for reviewing this matter with the fairness it deserves. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I was not notified in advance that these accounts would be marked late, which denied me the opportunity to address any potential issues before they were reported. 

2. Possible Unauthorized Reporting and Account Compromise Due to Data Breach - The reported data breach involving XXXX raises serious questions about the integrity of my loan accounts. If my data was exposed or manipulated, XXXX XXXX have incorrectly or fraudulently reported late payments that I did not actually incur. 

3. Failure to Properly Investigate and Verify Account Status - Given the security risks and errors in reporting, I request full verification and documentation proving the legitimacy of the late payments, including a detailed account history showing how and when they were marked late.

However, I was just notified by a XXXX XXXX alert that I had received a XXXX delinquency on their loan which I have only XXXX payment, XXXX have separated into XXXX separate loans thus reported XXXX separate XXXX  day delinquent notifications that reduced my XXXX XXXX by XXXX points overnight. I contacted them and immediately paid the past due balance plus the current month and intend on fully paying every single month until this loan is resolved. There was poor communication in regards to when these loans were going to restart and I did not receive any notification personally. Due to laws allowing them to not report delinquent payments until XXXX days. I was then hit with a XXXX day delinquency on a loan that I make XXXX payment on, but they have split into XXXX accounts. Thus giving me XXXX separate XXXX day delinquent payments on my credit report dropping my credit from a rising XXXX to XXXX overnight. This completely destroyed my credit for years to come. Up to XXXX XXXX students are facing the same situation and there are hundreds of thousands of people online complaining about the same thing happening to them. Nelnet, due to the way that they report delinquencies only has to report it after XXXX days, not giving me the opportunity to make current before a catastrophic credit reduction. There are news articles all over the XXXX and XXXX with thousands of responses from people having the same situation happen to them. I asked Nelnet if since I immediately resolved the past due balance, if there was any way that they could do me a XXXX time favor and remove those derogatory marks from my credit reporting to save my credit after never having a prior late payment. They said no, and it was my problem. Considering the millions of people who are affected by this, and the lack of communication and transparency involved in making students aware after XXXX  years of deferred repayment. I immediately resolved the balance with intent to pay the entire balance off within a year. I believe these late payments were due to lack of communication and nothing else. I believe that with my good faith payment resolving the past due balance, and the current month due that combined with the XXXX of any prior reporting at XXXX or XXXX days, thus notifying me in order to resolve it prior to the XXXX  day mark, which has such a huge impact on my XXXX XXXX that I should be able to request the removal of those XXXX  day delinquencies from my credit report. Nelnet refuses to assist even after correcting this balance, but this is going to set me back for years to come and hurt me in areas essential to my growth and contribution to society. Due to the widespread amount of people affected by this, I hope that there is a plan in place to help honest, hard-working citizens from losing their ability to grow and contribute to the society and economy. I take responsibility for letting it slip my mind after XXXX years of deferred payments mandated by the XXXX government and have steadily grown my credit score over the last XXXX years to get to the point where I was. This is devastating to me and thousands and thousands of other Americans. Due to the abnormality of this long-term student loan, deferment and lack of communication I believe that at the very least they should be accepting XXXX letters and removing those negative marks from my credit report. Now that Im aware, if I were to make late payments. There would be no complaint on my part. But this essentially destroyed my credit overnight.

This includes but is not limited to : 1.My academic records and personally identifiable information ( PII ).

2.My Free Application for Federal Student Aid ( FAFSA ) data, including financial aid history and loan information.

3.My IRS tax transcripts, which were obtained and used without proper authorization.

These actions violate my rights under FERPA ( 20 U.S.C. 1232g ; 34 CFR Part 99 ), which grants me the right to control access to my educational records, as well as Title IV of the Higher Education Act, which governs the use and protection of federal student aid information. Furthermore, unauthorized access to my IRS tax data raises serious concerns regarding potential identity theft, fraud, and violations of federal data security standards.

Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding my student loans, as I am currently coming out of forbearance and have noticed some troubling discrepancies with my loan balances and interest rates. 

Over the years, my loans have been sold several times, which I understand may contribute to some of the confusion surrounding my account. However, I am concerned about the substantial increases in interest rates that I have seen on some of my loans. When I originally took out the loans, the interest rates were set at a standard percentage. However, it appears that these rates have significantly increased, which I believe is unfair and potentially in violation of the original terms of my loan agreements. 

Given the financial strain I have faced in trying to keep up with payments, especially during and after forbearance, it is disheartening to see the interest rates skyrocketing and my balances growing despite my efforts to make payments. I find this situation to be unfair, and I believe that my loans should be handled in accordance with the terms originally agreed upon, without unjustified increases in interest. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate my loans and help ensure that my balances and interest rates are accurate. I am also seeking guidance on what steps I can take to resolve this matter with my loan servicer.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Nelnet received my negotiable Bill of Exchange ( BOE ) on XX/XX/year>, clearly issued with the intent to lawfully settle and close my federal student loan account. This instrument, presented in good faith, constituted a remittance to satisfy the outstanding obligation under contract and commercial law principles. Despite confirmation of receipt, Nelnet has willfully refused to settle the account and continues to report it as delinquent, leading to a significant drop in my credit score of over XXXX points. This is not merely a servicing error it is a knowing, reckless, and fraudulent act. 

Nelnets continued reporting and collection activity directly violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( XXXX U.S.C. XXXX et seq. ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( XXXX U.S.C. XXXX ), as well as the Department of Educations own borrower servicing guidelines. Their refusal to correct the record despite evidence of settlement constitutes willful misrepresentation of the accounts status. 

Moreover, this conduct amounts to fraudulent accounting under multiple sections of the ASC ( Accounting Standards Codification ), specifically : ASC 450 ( Contingencies ) : Nelnet has failed to disclose or account for contingent liabilities created by federal guarantees or potential reimbursements tied to the loan. 

ASC 860 ( Transfers and Servicing ) : If the loan was sold or securitized, it should have been derecognized from Nelnets books ; continued collection represents a second monetization of an already-settled asset. 

ASC 942 ( Financial Services - Depository and Lending ) : Nelnet has not provided full servicing disclosures, nor acknowledged its role in collecting on an account it may no longer own, which is materially misleading to both the borrower and the federal government. 

These failures, combined with inaccurate credit reporting and the ongoing damage to my financial standing, are causing irreparable harm and deserve immediate federal intervention. I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly and coordinate, if necessary, with the U.S. Department of Education, the Office of Inspector General, and the SEC to enforce compliance with accounting regulations, consumer protection laws, and to compel Nelnet to reflect the account as settled, paid in full, and never late. Their refusal to update their books and cease harmful reporting practices constitutes accounting fraud and administrative negligence at the highest level.

b'Subject: Request for Immediate Removal of Student Loan Account from Credit Report Due to FERPA Violation

To Whom It May Concern,

I am formally disputing a student loan account listed on my credit report. This account was accessed without my knowledge or consent, which is a direct violation of my rights under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 20 U.S.C.  1232g.
Specifically, I have submitted a FERPA complaint to the U.S.
Department of Education regarding unauthorized access to my student loan records by XXXX XXXX or affiliated parties.
Accessing or sharing educational records without written permission is illegal under federal law.
Due to this privacy violation, I am requesting the immediate removal of the student loan account from my credit report.
This account should not remain on my record while there is an active investigation into illegal access of my private information.
Please remove the following account:

XXXX
DEPTEDNELNET
XXXX XXXX XXXX NE XXXX  USA
(XXXX XXXXXXXX

Under both the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and FERPA, I have a legal right to dispute and block the reporting of any account involving unauthorized access. Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Co-signer
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2020, I endorsed a Direct PLUS Loan for my mother, serviced originally by Nelnet. 

During the federal student loan servicing transition in XXXX, our loan was transferred ( or split ) to XXXX. This was terrible timing as the CARES Act was put into effect on XX/XX/2020 and extended multiple times throughout the years. 

My mother did not receive any notification or correspondence regarding the servicer change, which is required by federal regulations. 

My sister, who was making the payments, was unaware of the transfer and thus missed payments on the portion managed by NelNet. 

These missed payments were reported to the credit bureaus, negatively impacting both my mothers and my credit reports. 

We only became aware of the issue upon reviewing our credit reports. 

My sister immediately set up autopay to bring the accounts current, but the late payments remain on our credit reports. 

As the endorser of this Direct PLUS Loan, I understand that my obligation is to repay the loan if the borrower fails to do so. The Addendum to the Master Promissory Note ( MPN ) that I signed repeatedly states, an endorser is someone who agrees to repay the Direct PLUS Loan if the borrower does not repay the loan. It also specifically notes : If the borrower of a Direct PLUS Loan becomes delinquent in making payments or defaults on the loan, we may also report your name to consumer reporting agencies in connection with the delinquent or defaulted loan. The use of the word may indicates that reporting my name for delinquencies is discretionary, not mandatory.

In my case, the borrower did not default on the loan ; there were only late payments due to a lack of notification during a servicer transition. I was never notified of the delinquency or given an opportunity to bring the account current before negative information was reported on my credit. Given the discretionary nature of reporting as outlined in the MPN, and the fact that I was not afforded a reasonable opportunity to address the situation, I believe it is unfair and inconsistent with the spirit of the agreement to have my credit negatively impacted under these circumstances. 

I have a strong history of on time payments, and if given the chance and proper communication, I would have kept the account status current, thus preventing any delinquency on my credit report as well as my mother 's.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint in connection with the student loans I took out to attend XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), a private college that closed permanently in XXXX. I enrolled in XXXX between XXXX and XXXX based on misrepresentations about the value of their degree, career outcomes, and the support they claimed to offer. I was encouraged to take out federal student loans, which were framed as standard and manageable. However, I was not properly informed of the long-term financial consequences, and the school failed to provide adequate financial aid counseling or transparency about their institutional instability. 

XXXX concealed the fact that it was already facing major financial problems while I was enrolled, and never disclosed that it was operating under unsustainable debt. There were no real career services or job placement after graduation, and the education I received was not competitive in the job market. Ive been unable to secure employment in my field, which has made it extremely difficult to repay these loans. 

After graduating, I experienced severe financial hardship and could not consistently make loan payments. Ive had to rely on deferment and forbearance options, which have only increased the interest I owe. Ive also suffered serious health consequences due to the debt burden, including being unable to afford housing, dental care, and mental health services. I have since applied for Borrower Defense loan forgiveness with the U.S. Department of Education. 

The damage from XXXX  misconduct and the mismanagement of my student loan experience continues to affect my financial and personal wellbeing.

Instantly, I pulled my report to see why, and there are 6 accounts ( all paid by XXXX to XXXX service provider ) now listed as delinquent with ZERO notifications since XX/XX/year>. I called them to find out the issue, my auto pay wasn't working and I was {$690.00} dollars past due. {$690.00} ... .let that sit and because it is one payment spread across XXXX accounts, they marked XXXX of those delinquent. Why the XXXX wasn't marked, I have no idea. But regardless, that hit 's your credit score XXXX harder for XXXX payment, a past due balance I was unaware of. So I took a XXXX point drop for {$690.00} due to NelNets failure to communicate or use my auto pay.

Consumer complaint narrative: Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Information under FCRA and FDCPA Compliance I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies in my credit report as per my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). The following accounts contain erroneous, unverifiable, and misleading information that must be investigated and corrected immediately. Account Disputes : Ed Financial XXXX ( Original Creditor : Department of Education/XXXX  XXXX XXXX. Account name EDFINANCIAL SERVICES  XXXX Account XXXX Dispute Basis : The reported date opened is ( XX/XX/year> ), which is impossible. I never authorized information tl be soled to third party. I havent signed any agreements for this action. This is clearly inaccurate and unverifiable per Metro 2 compliance. Please delete this account immediately. As per the FCRA, a hard inquiry can only be listed on my credit report if I initiated the application process and granted explicit consent. Please provide evidence of my signed authorization or remove these inquiries immediately. Per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), you are required to conduct an investigation within XXXX days and remove any information that can not be verified or is inaccurate. Additionally, under Metro 2 compliance, data furnishers must ensure all reported information is complete, accurate, and timely. The erroneous information listed above fails to meet these requirements and must be removed immediately. Please provide written confirmation of the deletions or corrections within the required time frame.

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Don't agree with the fees charged
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint regarding unauthorized interest accrual on my XXXX XXXX XXXX  enrolled in the SAVE ( Saving on a XXXX XXXX ) plan. Despite the Department of Education 's explicit guidance that loans under the SAVE plan should not accrue interest during the administrative forbearance period, Aidvantage has allowed interest to accrue on my account, resulting in an increase in my loan balance. 

Here is a summary of the issue and timeline : Department of Education Guidance : The Department of Education mandated that all borrowers enrolled in the SAVE plan be placed into an interest-free administrative forbearance beginning XX/XX/XXXX, due to ongoing legal challenges. During this period, no interest was supposed to accrue on loans. 

Aidvantage 's Actions : Aidvantage stated in their letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, that my loans were in a general forbearance with no interest accruing from XX/XX/XXXX, through XX/XX/XXXX. 

However, they claim that when I submitted a new Income-Driven Repayment ( IDR ) application on XX/XX/XXXX, my loans were moved into a " processing forbearance '' for up to 60 days. During this processing forbearance, Aidvantage allowed interest to accrue on my loans starting XX/XX/XXXX, despite my enrollment in the SAVE plan. 

When my application was not processed within the 60-day window, Aidvantage states that my account was moved back into a general forbearance effective XX/XX/XXXX, during which interest was set to 0 %. 

Impact : My loan balance increased from {$72000.00} ( as of XX/XX/XXXX ) to {$73000.00} as of nowa difference of {$1300.00} in unauthorized accrued interest. 

This interest accrual violates the Department of Educations directive that loans under the SAVE plan should not accrue interest during administrative forbearance. 

Attempts to Resolve : I have made over a dozen phone calls to Aidvantage since XX/XX/XXXX, totaling more than 12 hours of time spent trying to resolve this issue. 

During each call, I was promised a supervisor callback within 24-48 business hours, but no supervisor has ever followed up with me. 

I escalated this issue to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB Complaint # XXXX ), but Aidvantage falsely reported to the CFPB that the issue was resolved when it was not. 

Why This Is a Problem : Aidvantages actions are inconsistent with federal regulations and Department of Education mandates regarding the SAVE plan. The Department explicitly stated that borrowers enrolled in SAVE should not accrue interest during administrative forbearance. By allowing interest to accrue during the processing forbearance period ( XX/XX/XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ), Aidvantage has violated these directives. 

Additionally : Their explanation in their XX/XX/XXXX letter does not align with federal guidance. 

Their failure to follow through on promised callbacks and their false reporting to the CFPB demonstrate systemic issues in their handling of borrower complaints.

What I Am Requesting : Immediate removal of the {$1300.00} in unauthorized accrued interest from my account. 

Restoration of my loan balance to {$72000.00} as it was in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Written confirmation from Aidvantage detailing these corrections and assurances that no further interest will accrue while my account remains under administrative forbearance as mandated by the Department of Education.

Accountability for Aidvantages false reporting to the CFPB and failure to provide adequate customer service. 

A formal investigation into whether Aidvantage is systematically violating Department of Education mandates regarding SAVE plan borrowers.

This issue has caused significant stress and wasted time due to Aidvantages noncompliance and lack of accountability. I request immediate action from both Aidvantage and federal authorities to resolve this matter fairly and ensure compliance with federal regulations moving forward. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Mohela, the federal student loan servicer responsible for my account, due to their failure to honor a deferment agreement, improper credit reporting, and lack of customer support. Their actions have resulted in significant financial harm by inaccurately reporting my loan as more than 90 days delinquent despite my deferment approval. 
On XX/XX/year>, XXXX approved me for a six-month deferment on my student loan. Mohela took over my loan on XX/XX/year>, but failed to honor this agreement. Instead, they reported my account as delinquent, severely damaging my credit score and financial standing.

Issues with Mohelas Handling of My Loan : 1. Inaccurate Credit Reporting : Mohela falsely reported my account as more than 90 days past due, even though my loan was in an approved deferment period.

2. Denied Account Access : Despite Navient informing me that my login credentials would remain valid, Mohelas system does not recognize my account information.

3. Lack of Customer Support : I have made multiple attempts to contact Mohela by phone with no success and have been unable to access my loan details online.

4. Loss of Documentation : I can not retrieve my deferment approval paperwork from XXXX, as their website has been shut down. 
Requested Actions by the CFPB : Investigate Mohelas handling of my student loan and require them to correct their credit reporting errors immediately. 
Ensure that my credit report is updated to remove the false delinquency and reflect the deferment period granted by XXXX. 
Hold Mohela accountable for their failure to provide borrowers with accessible account management and customer support. 
Implement stronger oversight and consumer protections to prevent other borrowers from facing similar issues. 
Proposed that the remaining of ALL of my student loans be FORGIVING. 
Mohelas mishandling of my account has caused undue financial harm, and I am seeking the CFPBs intervention to ensure they correct their actions. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Complaint Against Loan Servicer & Credit Bureaus Subject : Illegal Student Loan Reporting & Collections Following Department of Education Abolishment To Whom It May Concern, I am filing a formal complaint against XXXX affiliated with the US Department of Education, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for continued reporting and collection of student loan debt that is now legally void following the executive order to abolish the U.S. Department of Education. 

# # # Complaint Details : 1. Illegal Credit Reporting The credit bureaus continue to report student loans that are now unverified and legally questionable due to the dissolution of the Department of Education. 

2. Failure to Verify Legitimacy of Debt The loan servicer has failed to provide evidence of legal ownership, collection rights, or servicing obligations in light of the agencys abolishment.

3. Unfair and Deceptive Practices The continued collection of these debts constitutes a violation of my rights under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and FDCPA ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ). 

I demand an immediate investigation, deletion of these accounts from my credit report, and cessation of any collection efforts by my loan servicer. If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will pursue further legal action. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
